intro: Vochysia guatemalensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan velvet tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically eaten by various bird species. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
